intro: Didymocarpus anthonyi, commonly known as the Anthony's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
